Package production.aleatory.SolarPanel.mil

Class ExternalWeatherModel

java.lang.Object
fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.Model
fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.AtomicModel
fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.AtomicHIOA
production.aleatory.SolarPanel.mil.ExternalWeatherModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.interfaces.VariableDefinitionsAndSharingI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.interfaces.VariableInitialisationI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.interfaces.AtomicModelI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.interfaces.EventsExchangingI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.interfaces.ModelI, Serializable
@ModelExportedVariable(name="externalSolarIrradiance", type=java.lang.Double.class) public class ExternalWeatherModel extends fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.AtomicHIOA
The class ExternalWeatherModel defines a simulation model for the environment, namely the sunshine.

Like the temperature, the sunshine (solar irradiance) has the same behavior.

The model makes the sunshine (solar irradiance) vary over some period representing typically a day. The variation is taken as a cosine between Math.PI and 3*Math.PI. The cosine (plus 1 and divided by 2 to vary between 0 and 1) is taken as a coefficient applied to the maximal variation over a day and then added to the minimal sunshine to get the current sunshine.

  • Imported events: none
  • Exported events: none
  • Imported variables: none
  • Exported variables: name = externalSolarIrradiance, type = Double

White-box Invariant

 invariant      cycleTime >= 0.0 && cycleTime <= PERIOD
 invariant      STEP > 0.0

Black-box Invariant

 invariant      MAX_EXTERNAL_SOLAR_IRRADIANCE > MIN_EXTERNAL_SOLAR_IRRADIANCE
 invariant      PERIOD > 0.0

Created on : 2023-11-11

Author:
Daniel SIMA
